events.message: Customer reported a car accident that occurred on April 30th involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorised as an auto accident, confirming keywords such as car, collision, and accident in the report.
An insurance agent specializing in vehicle-related claims was assigned to manage the investigation and customer communication.
Acknowledgement sent to the customer confirming receipt of their auto accident claim and outlining the next steps.
Request sent to the customer for a copy of the police report, photos of vehicle damage, and insurance documents for processing.
Customer submitted all requested documentation including police report and photographs of the damaged car from the collision.
Investigation into the auto accident began with the examination of submitted documents and initial interviews with involved parties.
The investigation concluded confirming the circumstances of the collision and evaluating liability and damage extent.
A settlement amount was proposed to the customer based on repair estimates and policy coverage related to the car accident.
Customer responded to the settlement proposal expressing satisfaction with the offer and appreciation for the prompt handling.
The claim was officially approved after customer's acceptance of the settlement, confirming coverage under the auto policy.
Settlement payment was processed and issued to the customerâ€™s designated bank account for vehicle repairs.
The auto accident claim file was closed after full payment was confirmed and all claim obligations were fulfilled.
